intro: Kosteletzkya adoensis var. hispidissima, commonly known as the hispid prickly poppy, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves, which give it a distinctive, rugged appearance. The plant produces showy, yellow-orange flowers that bloom in late summer. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky soils. Its fibrous roots and adaptive features make it well-suited for harsh, dry climates.
